title: Why we know only few things about our world and many things are still mysterious? - Quora

response.answer_text: Outside things seem mysterious because we skip right over the many known parts to get to the boundary with the unknown.  e.g. selection bias.   We also project the mysteries inside ourselves out onto the natural world.  Inside things are mysterious because we ask ourselves questions with no answer, believe things without enough examination and have a damn hard time understanding how our minds work.  The human condition is always mysterious.
